lines.text: I love you". Such would I say to him if he were really here.
Come back to me.
I am an actress, Mr. Robinson, not a doormat. Do not attempt to wipe your boots on me.
[seeing Richard for the first time]
Is it you? Is it?
This is not for a play, Miss Roberts. This is something very personal.
[shows her the pocketwatch]
Where did you get that?
Well, she gave it to me, ma'am. At the opening of a play I wrote eight years ago at Millfield College.
That watch was very precious to her. She never- never left it out of her possession. It disappeared the night she died.
She died that night?
Please, don't leave. You have no idea how far I've come to be with you.
Reechard. Reeeeeeechaaaarrrrd.
I owe you an apology. I understand you now. You have nothing but the best motives in mind for her, but so do I.
[repeated line]
See you around, Arthur.
Have we ever met before?
'I love you.'
[last lines]

[on telephone]
Operator? Get Dr. Paul up to suite 313 right away.
Looks like he hasn't eaten in a week. You better send for an ambulance.
I'll call one right now.
What a shame. If I'd only known.

[on telephone]
Operator? Get an ambulance. Right away.
He is going to make it, isn't he?
I don't know.
They're on their way. How is he?
We're going to need some oxygen.
Oh...
We've got some downstairs. I'll get it right now.
Keep him warm with this blanket. Such a fine man. What a shame. I wonder what happened.
We've gotta keep him going until they get here.

[on telephone, distant]
Gladys, this is Arthur again, in Mr. Collier's suite. We've got to
[fades out]
Excess within control.
[first lines]
[various snippets in crowd chatter]
I got some news. There was an agent in the house tonight, and he said he thinks this play might be good enough for Broadway.
[cheers from crowd]
Fingers crossed, who knows? Come on, let's all have some cake.
Arthur, you know in the Hall of History, there's a photograph, a young woman. There's no nameplate.
Yes, that's Elise McKenna. She was a famous actress in her day. Starred in a play in the hotel theater.
I-I'm sorry. Did you say there was a theater here?
Yes. Down by the lake.
Really? When was this play done?
You will marry me won't you?

[Richard coughs and splutters]
Sorry
You won't?
[she asks rather worriedly]
Sure, I Was just laughing at the way you asked that's all
For one moment there, I thought you had a wife and children back home somewhere
[she chuckles]
Oh Elise
